actions.name: Progress stepper change event

components.label: HTML
components.content:
As a prospective member of Coordinated Operation Response in Emergencies (CORE), it is crucial that you acknowledge and understand the commitments involved for the Emergency Management & Climate Readiness (EMCR) and the BC Wildfire Service (BCWS) streams.

Before proceeding, please carefully read the details of each stream and their application instructions, make your stream choice, and then check off the acknowledgement statements that will appear below.

components.label: HTML
components.content:
Program Commitment

Approval into both streams does not guarantee deployment. If you received a deployment request, you may be required to be prepared for deployment on short notice and potentially for extended periods. This may involve travelling to an activation that's located anywhere in the province, and spending time away from family and other personal obligations. However, if you have any personal or work commitments that you must attend at the time of a deployment, you can choose to turn down a deployment opportunity.

You are expected to have a high level of adaptability, commitment, and professionalism in all of your endeavors for both EMCR and BCWS.


Application Requirements

To ensure a smooth application process, please make sure you complete and submit the following requirements relevant to the program(s) you are applying to (you can click on the following links to learn more or access the documents):

EMCR BCWS
  • Supervisor Approval for EMCR
  • Incident Command System (ICS) Training
  • Supervisor Approval for BCWS
  • Intro to CORE Online Orientation (Video)
  • Willingness Statement
  • Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire (ParQ)*

*Please make sure you have completed, signed, and submitted your BCWS ParQ to your Wildfire regional contact.
Don't know which Fire Centre email to submit your documents to? You can find your corresponding Fire Centre based on your home location at Where is my closest Fire Centre?.


What to expect during deployments

You may be asked to do multiple deployments as required by the event. However, you may accept or decline a request depending on your own availability, vacation leave, and/or regular work commitments.

Deployment Timeframes for each stream:

  • EMCR: You can be deployed for up to 10 consecutive days, followed by a mandatory two-day rest period before potential redeployment.
  • BCWS: You can be deployed for up to 14 consecutive days at a time (including travel duration).

components.label: Please select your program choice and acknowledge the statements appearing below.

values.label: I am only applying for the Emergency Management & Climate Readiness (EMCR) program this season.
I am only applying for the BC Wildfire Service (BCWS) program this season.
I am applying for both programs this season.

components.label: HTML
components.content: NOTE: Failure to complete certain requirements listed below may cause delays in your application process, further impacting your ability to participate in either stream.

components.label: Acknowledgement for BOTH streams (please check all to proceed):

values.label: As an applicant, I understand the expectations and commitments for both programs as indicated in the description above.
I confirm that I have requested approval from my supervisor to participate in both programs.
I understand that I must complete the relevant training courses  to participate in each program (ICS Training Course for EMCR and Intro to CORE Online Orientation for BCWS).
As a BCWS applicant, I confirm that I have read and understood the Willingness Statement and wish to participate.
As a BCWS applicant, I understand that I must complete and sign the ParQ Questionnaire and have this document submitted to my regional contact.

components.label: Acknowledgement for EMCR (please check all to proceed):

values.label: As an EMCR applicant, I understand the expectations and commitments for the program as indicated in the description above.
I confirm that I have requested approval from my supervisor, and I understand that I must complete the ICS training course to participate in the program.

components.label: Acknowledgement for BCWS (please check all to proceed):

values.label: As an BCWS applicant, I understand the expectations and commitments for the program as indicated in the description above.
I confirm that I have requested approval from my supervisor to participate in the program.
I confirm that I have completed the Intro to CORE online orientation course.
I confirm that I have read and understood the Willingness Statement and wish to participate.
I understand that I must complete and sign the ParQ Questionnaire and have this document submitted to my regional contact.

components.label: Next

components.html: Please provide your most up-to-date personal and employment details.
components.label: Text/Images
Home Location
components.description: Your home location will help us determine which fire centre or region you belong to. If your home location is not listed, please select the nearest location to your place of residence from the list.

components.label: BC Government Employee No.
components.description: This is your 6-digit employee number.

components.label: Work Location
components.description: This refers to the location of the office you report to

components.label: Division
components.description: Full division name, no acronyms.
components.placeholder: Please enter the division you are part of

components.label: Pay List (Dept ID)
components.description: You can find this information on your paystub.

components.label: HTML
components.content: We will notify your supervisor about the outcome of your application. If there is a change in your position or supervisor at any point, you must update this information and obtain your new supervisors approval to participate.

components.label: HTML
components.content:
Liaison information is required for BCWS applicants and is applicable only if you belong to the following:

  • Ministry of Forests
  • Ministry of Water, Land and Resource Stewardship
  • The Recreation Sites and Trails, and the BC Parks division under Ministry of Environment

If you are unsure who your liaison is, please check "I am unsure who my liaison is" down below. You may also reach out to your supervisor about who your liaison is.

components.label: I am unsure who my liaison is.
HTML
components.content: NOTE: If you are unwilling to travel to activation sites outside of your home location, your deployment opportunities may be limited. Deployment flexibility could also vary by role, with some requiring on-site presence. New CORE members may need to undergo on-site training.

values.label: If deployed, I am ONLY willing to work remotely from my home location.
If deployed, I am willing to travel outside of my home location.

components.label: Previous
Next

components.html: The EMCR and BCWS streams operate very differently with distinct sections and roles. For this step, please carefully review each stream's requirements in the blue banners as you proceed. Your responses will help us match your expertise and skillset with suitable roles.
components.label: Text/Images
HTML
components.content: Please select the program(s) you are applying for from the first tab of this form.

components.label: HTML
components.content:
For your EMCR application, you only need to indicate the following:

  • Your general experiences in emergency management. (This could include your past experiences in PREOC/PECC, or any outside emergency events).
  • Your interest in the following EMCR sections.

components.html: Please answer the following questions regarding your overall emergency management related experiences.
components.label: Text/Images
Do you have any direct experience related to emergency management?
Do you have any experience working in a Provincial Regional Emergency Operation Centre (PREOC)?
Do you have any experience working in a Provincial Emergency Coordination Centre (PECC)?
Do you have any direct experience working with Indigenous communities (e.g. living or working in a Reserve, working directly with Indigenous communities, etc.)?

components.html:
Please select the section(s) that you are interested in, if you were to be selected for deployment.

For your EMCR application, you must select AT LEAST one.
components.label: Text/Images
HTML
components.content: Please select at least one function for EMCR.

validate.customMessage: Please select at least one function

components.label: Operations
components.description: Responsible for organizing and managing the section to meet response activities and objectives. This includes triaging resource requests and identifying critical resources.

components.label: Emergency Support Services (ESS)
components.description: This is a provincial program for local authorities and Indigenous governments to deliver services to the public in an emergency. ESS roles fall under the Operations section in the Incident Command System (ICS) structure. In addition to support through TEAMS, they often depend on volunteers to coordinate these services for people forced from their homes because of an emergency.

components.label: Liaison
components.description: Acts as a point of contact for representatives from agencies and jurisdictions arriving at the Provincial Emergency Coordination Centre (PECC) or Provincial Regional Emergency Operation Centre (PREOC). This section may liaise with organizations not present.

components.label: Logistics
components.description: Responsible for all service support requirements needed to facilitate effective and efficient incident management, including ordering resources. This Section also provides facilities, security, transportation, supplies, equipment maintenance and fuel, food services, communications and information technology support, and emergency responder medical services, including inoculations, as required.

components.label: Planning
components.description: Responsible for collecting, evaluating, and disseminating operational information pertaining to the incident. It maintains information and intelligence on the current and forecasted situation, as well as the status of resources assigned to the incident. This section prepares and documents Incident Action Plans/Situation Report and incident maps and gathers and disseminates information and intelligence critical to the incident.

components.label: Advanced Planning Unit
components.description: Responsible for analyzing beyond operational period to identify potential consequences or issues. Advanced Planning is a function within the Planning section.

components.label: First Nations
components.description: Facilitates situational awareness and provides local and provincial level coordination to impacted First Nation communities. This branch may draw upon expertise from other ministries or agencies with experience and pre-existing relationships with First Nation communities. These roles require direct experience working with First Nations and/or lived experience in a working relationship with First Nations.

components.label: Recovery
components.description: This section is the phase of emergency management which aims to repair communities affected by disaster, restore conditions to an acceptable level, and restore self-sufficiency and increase resilience. It is a function within the Planning section to start the process of identifying needs/gaps and initiate short-term and priority recovery activities as soon as possible.

components.label: Deputy Director
components.description: Oversees the internal operation. The Deputy Director may be assigned some of the responsibilities held by the Director as needed. The Director has overall responsibility for coordinating and managing the provincial response to emergencies and disasters. Typically held by people who have had strong presence in this environment.

components.label: Finance
components.description: This section assembles and monitors all emergency management related costs, administers any necessary procurement contracts, and performs the function of managing the compensation and claims requirements. Some of the functions that fall within the scope of this section are recording personnel time, maintaining vendor contracts, administering compensation and claims, and conducting an overall cost analysis for the incident.

components.label: HTML
components.content:
For your BCWS application, you are required to indicate the following:

  • Your top 2 sections you wish to be deployed in;
  • Role(s) under any section that you may have experience in and/or is interested in.

Wildfire CORE members are generally deployed for the following positions. You can refer to BCWS Quick Reference Guide to Positions for a brief description of the duties involved in the positions. It is not expected that you have BCWS skills for positions you may interested in, however, related work sills and willingness to learn the position quickly and with limited supervision should be taken into consideration when expressing an interest. Please check ALL relevant boxes.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Please select at least one role for your first choice section.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Please select at least one role for your second choice section.

components.html:
For each section below, please indicate any role(s) that you have experience in and/or is interested in.

You must select AT LEAST ONE role under your first and second choice.
components.label: Text/Images
Please select role(s) and indicate your experience level for each.

components.label: Previous
Next
HTML
components.content:
Thank you for your application

Before submitting your application, please take a moment to review the information you have provided. Once you are satisfied with your entries, click the "Submit" button below to finalize your application.

Once again, please remember to submit the required documents and approvals relevant to the stream(s) you are applying for.

Failure to provide these required documents may cause delays to your application.

By submitting this form, you acknowledge that the information provided is accurate to the best of your knowledge.


Next Steps

A CORE Team Coordinator may reach out to you in the next 7 to 10 business days to further assess your experience and deployment readiness. Our response time may vary depending on ongoing operational tasks such as responding to emergency and wildfire across the province.

If you would like to recieve a confirmation email please click on "Email me a copy of this submission" on the next page.

components.html: Please be aware that duplicate submissions will not be accepted. If you have previously submitted an application, your original submission has been saved. Duplicate submissions will not be considered.
components.label: Content
